title: Having strange "mini disconnects"
body:
The past 1-2 weeks I had terrible ping spikes and would disconnect for a little often and it wasn't just in League, I had them when playing OverWatch too. 

The problem has mostly faded away by itself (I'm guessing the hurricanes caused some issues) but I'm still plagued with random 5-15 second periods where I "mini-disconnect" and can't move. When I come back I haven't disconnected and started walking back to base though, all of my button presses made during this period are done(if I'm I press R as Sejuani then the R will fling out the moment when I get control of my champion again) and I play as normal until the next one.

 I can get these from 2 to 6 times a game(usually 2 to 4) and I am also having these problems with OverWatch.

replies.body: This happens to me constantly, except it causes me to dodge games by not reconnecting and letting me lock in a champ. I am wired in, have a great connection otherwise all throughout game and I even tried turning off my firewall. No luck.

Oh yeah that must be pretty annoying.  :/  Your connection to the game server definitely seems unstable.  While it could be a routing issue I'm not sure it would disconnect you entirely but instead just give you higher ping.  

Start off with the steps in our [connection issues](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues) guide as this may be local issue that can be resolved through that.  Test it in a custom game, though!

Do you recommend doing  "Current Server Status" to "Disable Peer-to-Peer Updates(Windows 10 Only)" in the same order?


Also while checking to see if I had packet loss with Netalyzr it said I had no packet loss but says "my network indicated bursts of packet loss" which sounds like what's happening in my games, but I don't know what I'm supposed to do about it, the "Packet Loss" section gives no information about this.

You connect and download updated directly from our servers without peer-to-peer.  Was the guide able to help you out?

If you're still running into issues, hit us up in a [support ticket](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/requests/new) so our tech team can work with you directly and get this figured out!
